markdownRemark.html: Further on the epigrams, see now the facsimile of the first edition with introduction and translation by Franco Lazzari and Mario Lozzi, Gli epigrammi di Antonio Mancinelli, Velletri, Centro Studi 'Antonio Mancinelli', 2009. The authors argue convincingly (pp. 26-29) that Mancinelli's preferment at Orvieto in 1495 and his subsequent return to teaching at Rome resulted from his successful cultivation of Cesare Borgia.
